contentExpanded.html: The Warriors will celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the 1975 NBA Championship team during their home game on Friday, November 21 versus the Portland Trail Blazers, the team announced Wednesday.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors will celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the 1975 NBA Championship team during their home game on Friday, November 21 versus the Portland Trail Blazers, the team announced Wednesday.

contentExpanded.html: All living members of that Warriors team will be on hand for the celebration, including Rick Barry, Butch Beard, Charles Dudley, George Johnson, Jeff Mullins, Clifford Ray and Jamaal Wilkes. The late Alvin Attles will be represented by his son, Alvin Jr.
contentExpanded.text: All living members of that Warriors team will be on hand for the celebration, including Rick Barry, Butch Beard, Charles Dudley, George Johnson, Jeff Mullins, Clifford Ray and Jamaal Wilkes. The late Alvin Attles will be represented by his son, Alvin Jr.

contentExpanded.html: Throughout Friday night’s game, the Warriors will honor the 50th anniversary of the organization’s first West Coast championship in a variety of ways, including in-arena video features and a special on-court recognition. Additionally, the group will sign autographs inside the Golden State Shop from 5:50–6:25 p.m.
contentExpanded.text: Throughout Friday night’s game, the Warriors will honor the 50th anniversary of the organization’s first West Coast championship in a variety of ways, including in-arena video features and a special on-court recognition. Additionally, the group will sign autographs inside the Golden State Shop from 5:50–6:25 p.m.

contentExpanded.html: The 1974-75 season marked the Warriors’ 29th campaign in franchise history and 13th year in California. Golden State finished the regular season with a 48–34 record, capturing the Pacific Division title. Jamaal Wilkes earned NBA Rookie of the Year honors after averaging 14.2 points, 8.2 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 30.7 minutes while playing in all 82 games.
contentExpanded.text: The 1974-75 season marked the Warriors’ 29th campaign in franchise history and 13th year in California. Golden State finished the regular season with a 48–34 record, capturing the Pacific Division title. Jamaal Wilkes earned NBA Rookie of the Year honors after averaging 14.2 points, 8.2 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 30.7 minutes while playing in all 82 games.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors advanced through the playoffs by defeating the Seattle SuperSonics in six games before rallying from a 3–2 deficit to beat the Chicago Bulls in seven in the Western Conference Finals. Golden State then swept the Washington Bullets (4-0) in the NBA Finals, earning the franchise’s first championship on the West Coast. Rick Barry was named Finals MVP after averaging 29.5 points, 4.0 rebounds, 5.0 assists, 3.50 steals and 43.0 minutes during those four games.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors have won seven NBA championships: 1947, 1956, 1975, 2015, 2017, 2018 and 2022, the third-most in league history.

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors have announced a partnership with Sephora U.S., the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand, becoming the first Valkyries partner to join the Warriors portfolio. Sephora will become the official fragrance partner of the Warriors and Chase Center–spotlighting the growing men’s fragrance category–as well as the first-ever presenting beauty partner of the Warriors Dance Team.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors have announced a partnership with Sephora U.S., the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand, becoming the first Valkyries partner to join the Warriors portfolio. Sephora will become the official fragrance partner of the Warriors and Chase Center–spotlighting the growing men’s fragrance category–as well as the first-ever presenting beauty partner of the Warriors Dance Team.

contentExpanded.html: Through the partnership, Sephora and the Warriors will create exclusive digital content, including a dedicated season-long social content series that will spotlight players and Warriors Dance Team members on game days. Sephora will receive prominent placement at Chase Center, visible on broadcast and in-arena, and introduce new in-arena game features. Fans will also have access to a Sephora kiosk during all Warriors home games and Chase Center events featuring a curated selection of beauty product offerings available for purchase. In addition, Warriors Dance Team members will receive Sephora gifting throughout the season.
contentExpanded.text: Through the partnership, Sephora and the Warriors will create exclusive digital content, including a dedicated season-long social content series that will spotlight players and Warriors Dance Team members on game days. Sephora will receive prominent placement at Chase Center, visible on broadcast and in-arena, and introduce new in-arena game features. Fans will also have access to a Sephora kiosk during all Warriors home games and Chase Center events featuring a curated selection of beauty product offerings available for purchase. In addition, Warriors Dance Team members will receive Sephora gifting throughout the season.

contentExpanded.html: “This partnership marks a significant milestone for the broader Golden State organization,” said Mike Kitts, Golden State Chief Commercial Officer. “Sephora becoming the first Valkyries partner to expand and align with the Warriors not only reflects the strength and growth of the Valkyries brand, but also the shared values across all of our teams. We look forward to this partnership enhancing the experience for our fans and partners across all of our properties.”
contentExpanded.text: “This partnership marks a significant milestone for the broader Golden State organization,” said Mike Kitts, Golden State Chief Commercial Officer. “Sephora becoming the first Valkyries partner to expand and align with the Warriors not only reflects the strength and growth of the Valkyries brand, but also the shared values across all of our teams. We look forward to this partnership enhancing the experience for our fans and partners across all of our properties.”

contentExpanded.html: “We’re thrilled to partner with the Golden State Warriors as their first official fragrance partner, which underscores the expanding opportunity within men’s fragrance, and highlights Sephora’s commitment to bringing best-in-class, inclusive beauty offerings to new audiences,” said Sephora U.S. Chief Marketing Officer Zena Arnold. “This collaboration reflects our commitment to redefining what beauty means, and gives us an incredible opportunity to engage with new audiences, including male fans who are increasingly embracing self-expression and categories like prestige fragrance. Alongside our successful partnership with the Valkyries, this partnership with the Warriors allows us to continue championing confidence, creativity, and community both on and off the court, in our shared Bay Area home.”
contentExpanded.text: “We’re thrilled to partner with the Golden State Warriors as their first official fragrance partner, which underscores the expanding opportunity within men’s fragrance, and highlights Sephora’s commitment to bringing best-in-class, inclusive beauty offerings to new audiences,” said Sephora U.S. Chief Marketing Officer Zena Arnold. “This collaboration reflects our commitment to redefining what beauty means, and gives us an incredible opportunity to engage with new audiences, including male fans who are increasingly embracing self-expression and categories like prestige fragrance. Alongside our successful partnership with the Valkyries, this partnership with the Warriors allows us to continue championing confidence, creativity, and community both on and off the court, in our shared Bay Area home.”

contentExpanded.html: As part of their founding partnership with the Valkyries, Sephora is the naming rights partner for the team’s 31,800 square-foot, state-of-the-art Oakland-based performance center, the “Sephora Performance Center.”
contentExpanded.text: As part of their founding partnership with the Valkyries, Sephora is the naming rights partner for the team’s 31,800 square-foot, state-of-the-art Oakland-based performance center, the “Sephora Performance Center.”

contentExpanded.html:
About Sephora
Sephora is the world’s leading global prestige beauty retail brand. With 50 000 passionate employees operating in 35 markets, Sephora connects customers and beauty brands within the world’s most trusted and dynamic beauty community. We serve a highly engaged community of hundreds of millions of beauty followers across our global omnichannel network of more than 3 200 stores and iconic flagships, and our e-commerce and digital platforms, offering personalized and immersive seamless experiences across every touchpoint. With our curation of close to 300 brands and our own label, Sephora Collection, we offer the most unique and diverse range of prestige beauty products, tailored to our customers’ needs from fragrance to make-up, haircare, skincare and beyond, as we constantly reimagine the world of prestige beauty. Since our inception in 1969 in Limoges, France, and as part of the LVMH Group since 1997, we have been disrupting the prestige beauty retail industry. Today, we continue to break with convention to drive our mission to expand the way the world sees beauty and empower the extraordinary in each of us.

contentExpanded.html: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.
contentExpanded.text: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors trailed by as many as 16 points in the contest, but were able to take their first lead since 3-2 with just over five minutes left in the third quarter, and were able to hold an eight-point lead heading into the fourth frame. The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors trailed by as many as 16 points in the contest, but were able to take their first lead since 3-2 with just over five minutes left in the third quarter, and were able to hold an eight-point lead heading into the fourth frame. The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.

contentExpanded.html: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."
contentExpanded.text: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."

contentExpanded.html: Draymond Green picked up his fifth foul early in the fourth quarter, and the Warriors held serve without him and Stephen Curry in the game. Curry returned with just over eight minutes left in the contest and although a few runs from the Spurs, were able to hold the lead for the rest of the night, thanks in part to knocking down their free throws. The Warriors shot 32-from-36 (88.9%) from the free throw line.

Curry returned with just over eight minutes left in the contest and although a few runs from the Spurs, were able to hold the lead for the rest of the night, thanks in part to knocking down their free throws. The Warriors shot 32-from-36 (88.9%) from the free throw line.

contentExpanded.html: Jimmy Butler III added 28 points, eight rebounds and six assists in the win, and Moses Moody recorded 19 points in the contest.

contentExpanded.html:
CURRY'S HEAT CHECK
Stephen Curry scored 22 of his 46 points in the third quarter, as the Warriors erased a double-digit lead. Curry was on fire in the quarter, shooting 5-for-7 from the field, hitting three triples and knocking down all nine of his free throw attempts.
contentExpanded.text: CURRY'S HEAT CHECKStephen Curry scored 22 of his 46 points in the third quarter, as the Warriors erased a double-digit lead. Curry was on fire in the quarter, shooting 5-for-7 from the field, hitting three triples and knocking down all nine of his free throw attempts.

contentExpanded.html: Curry finished the game 13-for-25 from the field and 15-for-16 from the free throw line, with his 16 free throw attempts being his most since April 12, 2021.
contentExpanded.text: Curry finished the game 13-for-25 from the field and 15-for-16 from the free throw line, with his 16 free throw attempts being his most since April 12, 2021.

contentExpanded.html: Curry's 46 points was 43rd 40-point game since turning 30, the second most in NBA history, trailing just Michael Jordan (44 games).
contentExpanded.text: Curry's 46 points was 43rd 40-point game since turning 30, the second most in NBA history, trailing just Michael Jordan (44 games).

contentExpanded.html: Curry also passed Alex English (25,613 points) for 23rd all-time on the NBA points scored list in the first quarter.

contentExpanded.html:
DRAYMOND'S DEFENSE
Draymond Green did not have his best shooting night of the season, but had a tremendous impact on the game.
contentExpanded.text: DRAYMOND'S DEFENSEDraymond Green did not have his best shooting night of the season, but had a tremendous impact on the game.

contentExpanded.html: Green held the responsibility of guarding Victor Wembanyama. Although, Wembanyama finished the game with 31 points, 15 rebounds and 10 assists, he shot just 1-for-8 from the field when guarded by Draymond Green and finished the game with eight turnovers.
contentExpanded.text: Green held the responsibility of guarding Victor Wembanyama. Although, Wembanyama finished the game with 31 points, 15 rebounds and 10 assists, he shot just 1-for-8 from the field when guarded by Draymond Green and finished the game with eight turnovers.

contentExpanded.html: Green also finished the night with a game-high plus-15 differential.
contentExpanded.text: Green also finished the night with a game-high plus-15 differential.

contentExpanded.html: "Just the idea that he takes on these challenges," Curry said of Green guarding Wembanyama. "Offensively, we know as the season goes on, he will continue to be productive on that end, but for him, just look at the stats aside, he just made him work. He was physical all night, that's the only way you can go against a talent like that. You're going to give up numbers, but it's just a matter of how. I think he loved that effort and that challenge and that's the only way we won tonight."

I think he loved that effort and that challenge and that's the only way we won tonight."

contentExpanded.html:
MOODY FINDS HIS GROOVE
Moses Moody hit four three points in the first half while making his third start of the season. Moody finished the game with 19 points on 6-for-13 shooting. It was his fourth game this season recording 19-plus points.
contentExpanded.text: MOODY FINDS HIS GROOVEMoses Moody hit four three points in the first half while making his third start of the season. Moody finished the game with 19 points on 6-for-13 shooting. It was his fourth game this season recording 19-plus points.

contentExpanded.html:
HORFORD PASSES BIRD
With his first rebound of the game, Al Horford passed Hall of Famer Larry Bird (8,974 rebounds) on the NBA's all-time rebounds list.
contentExpanded.text: HORFORD PASSES BIRDWith his first rebound of the game, Al Horford passed Hall of Famer Larry Bird (8,974 rebounds) on the NBA's all-time rebounds list.

contentExpanded.html: Horford added nine points in the game, knocking down three 3-pointers, his second consecutive game with at least three triples.
contentExpanded.text: Horford added nine points in the game, knocking down three 3-pointers, his second consecutive game with at least three triples.

contentExpanded.html:
WARRIORS AVOID BACK-TO-BACK SWEEP
Wednesday night completed the Warriors' fourth back-to-back set of their 13-game season. The Warriors have swept one set, and split the other three.
contentExpanded.text: WARRIORS AVOID BACK-TO-BACK SWEEPWednesday night completed the Warriors' fourth back-to-back set of their 13-game season. The Warriors have swept one set, and split the other three.

contentExpanded.html:

contentExpanded.html:
• The Warriors improved to 7-6 on the season (2-6 on the road), snaping a six-game road losing streak and improving to 1-1 on the team’s current six-game road trip.
  • Golden State trailed by as many as 16 points in the win, the team’s largest comeback victory of the season and second double-digit comeback win of the year. 
  • Golden State scored a season-high 43 points in the third quarter, the team’s first 40-point quarter of the season, outscoring the Spurs 43-28 in the period. 
  • The Warriors have won nine of their last 12 games against the Spurs, including eight of the last nine in San Antonio. 
  • The Warriors concluded their fourth back-to-back set of the season, improving to 2-2 in the second game of a back-to-back. 
  • The Warriors became the first team in NBA history to win a game in which the opposing team had multiple players with triple-doubles, per the Elias Sports Bureau, as both Victor Wembanyama (31 points, 15 rebounds, 10 assists) and Stephon Castle (23 points, 10 rebounds, 10 assists) recorded triple-doubles for the Spurs. 
  • San Antonio lost its first home game of the season (5-1), marking the ninth time the Warriors have won a road game against an opponent that had won at least its first five home games.
    • The Warriors most recently did so on April 10, 2016, also against the Spurs, who had started the year 39-0 at home, giving Golden State an NBA-record-tying 72nd win of the season. 
  • Stephen Curry scored a season-high 46 points, his 73rd career 40-point game (second this season).
    • Curry scored 22 of his 46 points in the third quarter, his first 20-point quarter of the season (43rd career).
      • Of Curry’s 43 career 20-point quarters, 23 have come in the third quarter. 
    • Curry (23,657 career points) passed Alex English (23,613) for 23rd place on the NBA’s all-time scoring list. 
    • Curry now has now scored at least 40 points 43 times since turning 30 years old, which trails only Michael Jordan (44), and 12 times since turning 35, which equals Jordan and trails only LeBron James (15). 
  • Jimmy Butler III finished with 28 points, his eighth 20-point game of the season, to go with eight assists and six rebounds while hitting a season-high five 3-pointers (5-of-7 3FG). 
  • Moses Moody scored 19 points, hitting at least five 3-pointers for the fourth time this season (5-of-10 3FG). 
  • Al Horford scored nine points and grabbed three rebounds, passing Larry Bird (8,974 career rebounds) for 58th place on the NBA’s all-time rebounding list (8,977). 
  • Will Richard earned his second career start.

contentStructured.html: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.
contentStructured.text: Stephen Curry scored 46 points as the Golden State Warriors defeated the San Antonio Spurs 125-20 at Frost Bank Center on Wednesday night. The Warriors knocked down a season-high 21 3-pointers in the victory.

contentStructured.html: The Warriors trailed by as many as 16 points in the contest, but were able to take their first lead since 3-2 with just over five minutes left in the third quarter, and were able to hold an eight-point lead heading into the fourth frame. The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.

The Warriors outscored the Spurs 43-28 in the third quarter, led by Stephen Curry's 22-point quarter.

contentStructured.html: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."
contentStructured.text: "That third quarter is what we do," Stephen Curry said postgame. "Getting stops. Pushing. Creating easy offense. Thankfully, I was able to knock a couple down."

contentStructured.html: Draymond Green picked up his fifth foul early in the fourth quarter, and the Warriors held serve without him and Stephen Curry in the game. Curry returned with just over eight minutes left in the contest and although a few runs from the Spurs, were able to hold the lead for the rest of the night, thanks in part to knocking down their free throws. The Warriors shot 32-from-36 (88.9%) from the free throw line.

contentExpanded.html: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.
contentExpanded.text: Six Warriors scored in double figures as the Golden State Warriors defeated the Indiana Pacers 114-83 at Chase Center on Sunday night.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors outscored the Pacers 39-18 in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach. Jimmy Butler III had a near triple-double with 21 points, nine rebounds and seven assists. Will Richard added 15 points off the bench, while Quinten Post and Brandin Podziemski both scored 14 points.

contentExpanded.html:
14-0 RUN
With the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.
contentExpanded.text: 14-0 RUNWith the game tied at 65-65 later in the third quarter, the Warriors went on a 14-0 run in just over a three minute span during the end of third and beginning of the fourth quarter. The Pacers missed seven consecutive shots during the run, as the Warriors got scoring from five different players, highlighted by Moses Moody's 4-point play with 4.7 seconds remaining in the third quarter.

contentExpanded.html:
RICHARD'S FOURTH QUARTER SPARK
Will Richard scored 11 of his 15 points in the fourth quarter as the Warriors put the game out of reach. Richard was extremely effective in the frame, shooting 4-for-6 from the field. He was very active near the rim, first rejecting a screen and cutting to the hoop, with Jimmy Butler III finding him for a wide open lay-up. He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

contentExpanded.html: "Just being so insightful," Richard said of how his teammates have helped him adjust to the NBA. "I feel like I ask them a lot of questions about where they like to be on the court, where I fit in, and stuff like that. All of them have been helpful telling me exactly where to go and stuff like that. So I’ll probably just say the way they've guided me throughout my transition to the NBA."

But before any and all that stuff I just think our pace was great, we were spaced incredibly well tonight on offense, so it looked a lot better."

contentExpanded.html: TEAM NOTABLES:
contentExpanded.text: TEAM NOTABLES:

contentExpanded.html:
• The Warriors won their fifth consecutive home game and have not lost at Chase Center this season... The last time the Warriors began a season winning five-straight home contests was the 2018-19 season when they opened the season with six consecutive home victories.
  • Tonight’s win snapped a four-game losing streak to Indiana (home and road) and a six-game losing streak to the Pacers at Chase Center… Entering tonight’s contest, the Pacers had never lost at Chase Center (6-0).
  • The two teams split the 2025-26 season series, 1-1… According to the Elias Sports Bureau, this is the fifth-fewest games into a campaign that the Warriors have completed a season series vs. an opponent (the record is six games, during the 2005-06 season, against the Knicks)… For the Pacers, this is the second fewest games (10) for them to finish playing an opponent in a single season (nine, twice). 
  • The Warriors held the Pacers to 83 points, the second fewest they have allowed to an opponent this season (79, 10/28/25 vs. LAC)… The 83 points scored matched the fewest points Warriors have allowed to the Pacers in a contest all-time (3/5/99).
  • Golden State’s 31-point margin of victory was the highest this season (prev. 19, 98-79 on 10/28/25 vs. LAC) and the largest since a 38-point win on 4/8/25 at PHX (133-95)… The last time the Warriors won a home game by that margin was on 2/25/25 vs. CHA (128-92)… The 31-point win also marked the team’s largest win in a game without Stephen Curry since he entered the league in 2009-10 (ESPN). 
  • The Warriors turned the ball over 10 times, the second-fewest in a game this season (nine on 10/23/25 vs. DEN)… Golden State improved to 4-0 when recording fewer turnovers than the team’s opponent this season (IND – 22). 
  • For the second time this season the Warriors had six players score in double figures (other instance was on 10/23/25 vs. DEN).
  • For the sixth time this season the Warriors recorded at least 10 steals (11 tonight). Their record in those contests is 4-2.
  • Tonight marked the Warriors’ 570th consecutive sellout, the second-longest active streak in the NBA and the sixth-longest all-time. 
  • Jimmy Butler III recorded a game-high 21 points, team-high nine rebounds, team-high seven assists, two steals and one block… It was Butler III’s seventh 20-point game of the current campaign, and second this season against the Pacers (20 on 11/1/25 at IND).
  • Will Richard tallied 15 points off the bench, his third consecutive game scoring in double figures (averaging 19.0 ppg in that span)… His seven made free throws are the most for a Warriors rookie since Jonathan Kuminga made seven on 3/28/22 at MEM.
  • Al Horford grabbed four rebounds, moving him with into a tie for 58thplace on the NBA all-time rebounds list (Larry Bird, 8,974 career rebounds)… Horford made all four of his 3-point attempts to finish with 12 points, his second game scoring 10-or-more points this season. 
  • Jonathan Kuminga grabbed eight rebounds, extending his career-best rebounding streak of five-or-more to 10 consecutive games.
  • Quinten Post recorded a season-high tying 14 points (third time) and season-high tying eight rebounds (10/28 vs. LAC) in his sixth start of the season.  
  • Stephen Curry missed his third consecutive game with an illness (the Warriors are 1-2 in games he has missed this season)… Since 2014-15, the Warriors are 75-113 (.399) without Curry in the lineup.

He then took Isaiah Jackson off the dribble and hit an 18-foot step-back jumper.

So I’m glad he got to see the ball go in."

contentStructured.html:
• The Warriors won their fifth consecutive home game and have not lost at Chase Center this season... The last time the Warriors began a season winning five-straight home contests was the 2018-19 season when they opened the season with six consecutive home victories.
  • Tonight’s win snapped a four-game losing streak to Indiana (home and road) and a six-game losing streak to the Pacers at Chase Center… Entering tonight’s contest, the Pacers had never lost at Chase Center (6-0).
  • The two teams split the 2025-26 season series, 1-1… According to the Elias Sports Bureau, this is the fifth-fewest games into a campaign that the Warriors have completed a season series vs. an opponent (the record is six games, during the 2005-06 season, against the Knicks)… For the Pacers, this is the second fewest games (10) for them to finish playing an opponent in a single season (nine, twice). 
  • The Warriors held the Pacers to 83 points, the second fewest they have allowed to an opponent this season (79, 10/28/25 vs. LAC)… The 83 points scored matched the fewest points Warriors have allowed to the Pacers in a contest all-time (3/5/99).
  • Golden State’s 31-point margin of victory was the highest this season (prev. 19, 98-79 on 10/28/25 vs. LAC) and the largest since a 38-point win on 4/8/25 at PHX (133-95)… The last time the Warriors won a home game by that margin was on 2/25/25 vs. CHA (128-92)… The 31-point win also marked the team’s largest win in a game without Stephen Curry since he entered the league in 2009-10 (ESPN). 
  • The Warriors turned the ball over 10 times, the second-fewest in a game this season (nine on 10/23/25 vs. DEN)… Golden State improved to 4-0 when recording fewer turnovers than the team’s opponent this season (IND – 22). 
  • For the second time this season the Warriors had six players score in double figures (other instance was on 10/23/25 vs. DEN).
  • For the sixth time this season the Warriors recorded at least 10 steals (11 tonight). Their record in those contests is 4-2.
  • Tonight marked the Warriors’ 570th consecutive sellout, the second-longest active streak in the NBA and the sixth-longest all-time. 
  • Jimmy Butler III recorded a game-high 21 points, team-high nine rebounds, team-high seven assists, two steals and one block… It was Butler III’s seventh 20-point game of the current campaign, and second this season against the Pacers (20 on 11/1/25 at IND).
  • Will Richard tallied 15 points off the bench, his third consecutive game scoring in double figures (averaging 19.0 ppg in that span)… His seven made free throws are the most for a Warriors rookie since Jonathan Kuminga made seven on 3/28/22 at MEM.
  • Al Horford grabbed four rebounds, moving him with into a tie for 58thplace on the NBA all-time rebounds list (Larry Bird, 8,974 career rebounds)… Horford made all four of his 3-point attempts to finish with 12 points, his second game scoring 10-or-more points this season. 
  • Jonathan Kuminga grabbed eight rebounds, extending his career-best rebounding streak of five-or-more to 10 consecutive games.
  • Quinten Post recorded a season-high tying 14 points (third time) and season-high tying eight rebounds (10/28 vs. LAC) in his sixth start of the season.  
  • Stephen Curry missed his third consecutive game with an illness (the Warriors are 1-2 in games he has missed this season)… Since 2014-15, the Warriors are 75-113 (.399) without Curry in the lineup.

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors fell 121-116 to the Sacramento Kings at Golden 1 Center on Wednesday night in a game that came down to the final minutes.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors fell 121-116 to the Sacramento Kings at Golden 1 Center on Wednesday night in a game that came down to the final minutes.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors led by five at the end of the first half, but a 35-23 third quarter in favor of the Kings put the Warriors down seven going into the final frame. The Dubs clawed their way back to even the game at 104-104. but the Kings went on an 11-0 run to take a double-digit lead with 3:27 remaining. But once again, the Warriors did not go away. A Brandin Podziemski 3-pointer with 57 seconds left cut the Warriors deficit to three points. A defensive stop gave the Warriors a chance to tie in the final 30 seconds, but a Jonathan Kuminga miss followed by two Dennis Schröder free throws put the game out of reach once and for all.

contentExpanded.html:
• This was the second game of the Warriors’ third set of back-to-backs …The Warriors are now 1-2 in the second game of back-to-backs this season … This was Golden State’s second split of back-to-back set (they swept the other one).
  • The Kings have won the last three regular season meetings against the Warriors and lead the 2025-26 regular season series, 1-0 … The next of four meetings is scheduled for January 9, 2026 at Chase Center.
  • This was the Warriors’ fourth clutch game of the season, third time in the last four games, as they fall to 1-3 in those contests.
  • This was the first time this season Stephen Curry (illness), Draymond Green (right rib contusion) and Jimmy Butler III (right low back strain) missed the same game … All-time, the Warriors are 27-8 when the trio plays.
  • The last time the Warriors started five players with no player having more than four years of NBA experience was on April 26, 2012 vs. San Antonio (last game of the regular season) when five rookies started: Chris Wright, Jeremy Tyler, Mickell Gladness, Klay Thompson, Charles Jenkins, according to the Elias Sports Bureau.
  • Will Richard, the 56th selection in the 2025 NBA Draft, made his first career NBA start and recorded a game-high and career-high 30 points (10-15 FG, 5-8 3P, 5-7 FT), seven rebounds, three assists and one steal in 34 minutes …
    • His 30 points are tied for the second-most by a player in their first career NBA start, which came as a member of the Warriors (37 by Anthony Morrow in 2008 and 30 by Jerry Lucas in 1970), according to the Elias Sports Bureau … Starters were first officially tracked in 1970-71. 
    • Richard made five 3-pointers, tied for the most by a player in their first career NBA start, which came as a member of the Warriors (5 from Mychal Mulder in 2020 and Justin Holiday in 2015). 
    • He is the second NBA rookie this season to score at least 30 points, joining 76ers rookie VJ Edgecombe who had 34 points.
  • Moses Moody tallied a season-high 28 points … Following last night’s 24 points last night vs. Phoenix, this is the second time Moody has scored at least 20 points in two straight games … He tied a career-high in 3-pointers made with six (2/1/22 at SAS).
  • Jonathan Kuminga had 24 points and a team-high-tying nine rebounds … Kuminga has grabbed at least five boards in every game this season, extending his career-best streak of five-or-more rebounds to nine games. With the loss, the Warriors fell to 5-4 overall. (4-0 home, 1-4 road).

MOODY'S ENCORE PERFORMANCE
Less than 24 hours removed from 24-point performance on Tuesday, Moses Moody once again shined. Moody scored 28 points on 9-for-15 shooting, knocking down a career-high-tying six threes.

contentStructured.html:
KUMINGA TAKES ON LARGER ROLE
Jonathan Kuminga took on a bigger role against Sacramento, with the Warriors missing three usual starters. Kuminga was able to score from all three levels in the game, recording 24 points and a team-high-tying nine rebounds.

contentStructured.html:
PODZIEMSKI'S NEAR TRIPLE-DOUBLE
Brandin Podziemski filled up the box score on Wednesday, recording 14 points, nine assists and nine rebounds, while also finishing with a team-best plus-14 differential.
contentStructured.text: PODZIEMSKI'S NEAR TRIPLE-DOUBLEBrandin Podziemski filled up the box score on Wednesday, recording 14 points, nine assists and nine rebounds, while also finishing with a team-best plus-14 differential.

contentStructured.html:
SHORTHANDED LINEUPS
The Warriors were without Stephen Curry (illness), Jimmy Butler III (back) and Draymond Green (rib) on Wednesday, in addition to De'Anthony Melton (knee) and Alex Toohey (knee). Meanwhile, the Kings were without usual starters Zach LaVine (back) and Domantas Sabonis (ribcage).

Meanwhile, the Kings were without usual starters Zach LaVine (back) and Domantas Sabonis (ribcage).

contentStructured.html:
UP NEXT 
The Warriors remain on the road, heading to Denver to face the Nuggets on Friday night (7 p.m. PT; Prime Video) in the team's first NBA Cup game. The team will then return to Chase Center to host the Indiana Pacers on Sunday, Nov. 9 (5:30 p.m.; NBCSBA) before opening up a six-game road trip.

The team will then return to Chase Center to host the Indiana Pacers on Sunday, Nov. 9 (5:30 p.m.; NBCSBA) before opening up a six-game road trip.

contentStructured.html: TEAM NOTABLES:
contentStructured.text: TEAM NOTABLES:

contentStructured.html:
• This was the second game of the Warriors’ third set of back-to-backs …The Warriors are now 1-2 in the second game of back-to-backs this season … This was Golden State’s second split of back-to-back set (they swept the other one).
  • The Kings have won the last three regular season meetings against the Warriors and lead the 2025-26 regular season series, 1-0 … The next of four meetings is scheduled for January 9, 2026 at Chase Center.
  • This was the Warriors’ fourth clutch game of the season, third time in the last four games, as they fall to 1-3 in those contests.
  • This was the first time this season Stephen Curry (illness), Draymond Green (right rib contusion) and Jimmy Butler III (right low back strain) missed the same game … All-time, the Warriors are 27-8 when the trio plays.
  • The last time the Warriors started five players with no player having more than four years of NBA experience was on April 26, 2012 vs. San Antonio (last game of the regular season) when five rookies started: Chris Wright, Jeremy Tyler, Mickell Gladness, Klay Thompson, Charles Jenkins, according to the Elias Sports Bureau.
  • Will Richard, the 56th selection in the 2025 NBA Draft, made his first career NBA start and recorded a game-high and career-high 30 points (10-15 FG, 5-8 3P, 5-7 FT), seven rebounds, three assists and one steal in 34 minutes …
    • His 30 points are tied for the second-most by a player in their first career NBA start, which came as a member of the Warriors (37 by Anthony Morrow in 2008 and 30 by Jerry Lucas in 1970), according to the Elias Sports Bureau … Starters were first officially tracked in 1970-71. 
    • Richard made five 3-pointers, tied for the most by a player in their first career NBA start, which came as a member of the Warriors (5 from Mychal Mulder in 2020 and Justin Holiday in 2015). 
    • He is the second NBA rookie this season to score at least 30 points, joining 76ers rookie VJ Edgecombe who had 34 points.
  • Moses Moody tallied a season-high 28 points … Following last night’s 24 points last night vs. Phoenix, this is the second time Moody has scored at least 20 points in two straight games … He tied a career-high in 3-pointers made with six (2/1/22 at SAS).
  • Jonathan Kuminga had 24 points and a team-high-tying nine rebounds … Kuminga has grabbed at least five boards in every game this season, extending his career-best streak of five-or-more rebounds to nine games. With the loss, the Warriors fell to 5-4 overall. (4-0 home, 1-4 road).

contentExpanded.html: The Golden State Warriors have exercised the fourth-year team option on guard Brandin Podziemski, it was announced Thursday.
contentExpanded.text: The Golden State Warriors have exercised the fourth-year team option on guard Brandin Podziemski, it was announced Thursday.

contentExpanded.html: Podziemski, 22, has appeared in five games (three starts) this season, averaging 12.2 points, 4.8 rebounds, 2.6 assists and 1.2 steals in 29.6 minutes per game. Originally selected by Golden State with the 19th overall pick in the 2023 NBA Draft, Podziemski earned 2023-24 NBA All-Rookie First Team honors, becoming the 19th player in franchise history to receive the recognition. The third-year guard has appeared in 143 career games (64 starts) with the franchise, averaging 10.4 points, 5.4 rebounds, 3.5 assists and 1.0 steal in 26.8 minutes per game.

contentExpanded.html: Golden State Warriors guard De’Anthony Melton, who underwent surgery to repair a torn left ACL on December 4, 2024, continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation. He has intensified his individual and small group on-court workouts and will be integrated into team practice over the next two weeks, including with the Santa Cruz Warriors. He will be re-evaluated again in three (3) weeks.
